metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18503 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When JavaScript is used to create and manipulate an audio buffer, a potentially exploitable crash may occur because of a compartment mismatch in some situations. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 65.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18503` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
